intro: Pariti bealii, commonly known as the Bornean tree fern, is a unique plant native to the tropical rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, feather-like fronds. The plant exhibits a slow growth rate and can reach heights of up to 10 meters in optimal conditions. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine, and it plays a vital role in the ecosystem as a habitat for various organisms. Due to habitat loss, Pariti bealii is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
